p: Recently, Dong et al. prepared self-assembled superparticles of Fe 3O 4 NPs with doped TiO 2 nanorods by using the surfactant-assisted self-assembly ( Xue et al., 2018). They found that the superparticles exhibit highly enhanced electrochemical properties, such as high specific capacity, rate capacity, and stable cycle performance of lithium storage. The significantly enhanced performance resulted from the synergistic effect between the co-assembled Fe 3O 4 NPs. First, the co-assembled Fe 3O 4 NPs improved the poor conductivity of TiO 2 superparticles. Second, the Fe 3O 4 NPs with a higher theoretical capacity contributed to the capacity of superparticles. Finally, the porosity and stability of the TiO 2 matrix provided enough stable void space to buffer the volume expansion of the Fe 3O 4 NPs, which improved cycling stability.
